content: row 44 21sc increase 21sc repeat seq 276 row 46 increase 22sc increase repeat seq 288 row 48 23sc increase 23sc repeat seq 300 row 50 increase 24sc increase repeat seq 312 row 52 25sc increase 25sc repeat seq 324 row 54 increase 26sc increase repeat seq 336 row 56 27sc increase 27sc repeat seq 348 row 58 increase 28sc increase repeat seq 360 row 60 29sc increase 29sc repeat seq 372 row 62 increase 30sc increase repeat seq 384 row 64 31sc increase 31sc repeat seq 396 row 66 increase 32sc increase repeat seq 408 row 68 33sc increase 33sc repeat seq 420 row 70 increase 34sc increase repeat seq 432 when you ve reached your desired size for your shawl feel free to add a border row of single crochet or 2 to 3 rounds of ribbing front and back post double_crochet you do not have to add the border of course if you wish to continue growing your shawl continue with the single_crochet increases as set out above by simply alternating the start of each single_crochet row weave ends into the same/back side of the work if you are watching the tutorial please hit the like button and subscribe to my channel as i hope to bring you lots more quick and easy projects please keep in touch via any of my social media my facebook page is at https/facebook com/thewoollyb if you have any questions please email me at thewoollyb@gmail com the information and photos in this post are the sole copyrighted property of bernadine bartjes aka the woolly b you may not copy and paste or reproduce any part of the information contained herein electronically verbally written or otherwise including translations you may sell products made from my patterns but i do ask that you please refer back to my pattern
